To me it doesn't smell remotely baccarat. The sillage and longevity is disappointing, I'm not sure if I go nose blind I have to douse this all over myself to get even a faint whiff</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2213071"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2213071#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2213010" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2213010" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="goldfever"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2166780"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="goldfever" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Marc-Jacobs/Daisy-Dream-25289.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25289.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Daisy Dream"title="Daisy Dream"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2213010ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2213010" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2166780">goldfever</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-09">07/09/24 10:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells like raspberries to me and not much else. It's very sweet and simple. Sometimes I get a tiny hint of orange. Not unpleasant but I don't find myself reaching for it over anything else.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2213010"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2213010#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2212886" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2212886" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Leeenas"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1931994"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1931994.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Leeenas" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2212886ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2212886" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1931994">Leeenas</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-09">07/09/24 07:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>On some days I love it, on others I dont. This perfume smells different on me every day. I get why some people reviewed that it smells like hospital or medicinal. Some days I smell that as well, it also sometimes resembles baccarat rouge, Zara red temptation. But on other days it smells like heavenly sweet, sugared strawberries, not sharp but in a warm way.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2212886"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2212886#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2210675" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2210675" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nnasteea"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2164532"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2164532.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="nnasteea" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bath-Body-Works/Bridgerton-Diamond-of-the-Season-91512.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.91512.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bridgerton Diamond of the Season"title="Bridgerton Diamond of the Season"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2210675ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2210675" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2164532">nnasteea</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-07">07/07/24 02:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The opening is sweet and gorgeous. <br />
<br />
I don't quite get strawberry as it's faint, but it is powdery and sweet.<br />
Personally, it lives up to the hype because the star of the show ins't the strawberry... It's the dry-down that turns into an angelic musk scent. <br />
<br />
The middle and base notes completely agree with my body making this a heavenly scent. I do recommend you try it on your skin first! <br />
<br />
The sillage is alright, probably a 6/10 for 3 sprays (but I do go nose blind).<br />
The longevity of the EDP is probably a 7/10. After 4-6 hours you don't get a strong whiff of the fragrance but it is noticeable if you are close. The dry-down musky scent remains after +8 hours, although definitely not as noticeable as when you first put it on.<br />
<br />
I live for musky scents, and so I find this EDP TO DIE FOR. Definitely a clean staple for almost every day use.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2210675"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2210675#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2209164" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2209164" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jow012"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1722924"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1722924.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jow012" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2209164ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2209164" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1722924">jow012</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-05">07/05/24 11:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I understand the hype about Her because the opening is so sweet and girly. I prefer this over the Elixir because it's not as cloying/intensely sweet. The issue is when sprayed on skin, both Her elixir and Her turn sour and have a really odd smell coming through about 10-15 minutes after spraying. It starts smelling artificial too quickly.<br />
<br />
I love the opening on Burberry perfumes, but the heart of the perfumes make me think twice about even buying travel sizes. I love Her EDT out of the entire line and have a small bottle- but you have to try all of them on skin first. Even Her EDT turns sharp on skin a few minutes after spraying. I have to layer it with something else.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2209164"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2209164#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2207765" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I have it and when im starting to wear it i always expect something so girly and fruity, but it always just ends up smelling little bitter and weird like a cat piss. Sometimes i like it tho, its light and wearable but i wouldnt get another bottle. Im not saying that its a bad perfume maybe it just doesnt go well with my skin, on clothes it smells really good..</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2207765"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2207765#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2207022" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2205539"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2205539#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2205002" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2205002" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mandie731"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2128810"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2128810.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mandie731" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Prada/Prada-Paradoxe-Virtual-Flower-95006.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.95006.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Prada Paradoxe Virtual Flower"title="Prada Paradoxe Virtual Flower"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2205002ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2205002" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2128810">Mandie731</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-01">07/01/24 13:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This reminded me of the smell of drumstick squashies. Very sweet, lactonic and synthetic smelling. I cant make up my mind as to whether I like it or not. It also has this weird, almost cold-like smell to it. I have never smelled BR540 before but I have sampled some dupes, and they all have that same cold, almost hospital like vibe to them. I cant pinpoint what it is, but I am starting to recognise the DNA now. The juries out on this one for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2205002"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2205002#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2204410" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2204410" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Woahitssteph"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2136642"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2136642.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Woahitssteph" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2204410ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2204410" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2136642">Woahitssteph</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-30">06/30/24 22:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I like it, but wouldnt buy again. Its way too sweet on me? Something about it reminds me so much of AG cloud.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2204410"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2204410#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2202260" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2202260" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Emmmm"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2179870"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Emmmm" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2202260ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2202260" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2179870">Emmmm</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-28">06/28/24 13:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The patchouli is far too heavy for me. I get the strawberry and patchouli and thats it. Far too sharp. This was really hyped and I really wanted to like it :( doesnt resemble cloud at all to me or cloud pink.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2202260"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2202260#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2201633" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2201633" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Rozalina"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1243220"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1243220.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Rozalina" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2201633ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2201633" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1243220">Rozalina</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-27">06/27/24 22:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>First of all, I love the bottle design, which is simple, chic, yet very girly. As far as the scent itself...hard pass. This is hailed as a BR540 dupe, but I think anyone who fell in love with that fragrance (at least with the extrait) will be sorely disappointed as Burberry Her has a very plasticky, artificial quality and none of the richness of its inspiration. This is like taking BR540 and infusing it with a Bonne Bell berry chap-stick. As far as the BR540 fruity dupes go, Ariana Grande's Cloud is a much smoother and yummier fragrance.<br />
<br />
<br />
Update 2024:<br />
For some reason, I had to get a bottle of Burberry Her despite 2020 me saying it smelled like BR540 infused with strawberry chapstick, lol. Aaand its still true! But now, I *personally* cant pinpoint the Baccarat DNA anymore, and if youve stayed away from that fragrance and its plethora of copycats in recent years, youd probably just smell a very contemporary, airy take on a strawberry milkshake perfume. It doesnt strike me as cheap but its so flagrantly fruity, carefree and Girly with a capital G, that it may register as juvenile to some. I prefer this to Burberry Her Elixir, which is too heavy handed, its missing the airy joie de vivre of the original.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2201633"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2201633#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2200830" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Its kind of nice and sweet, but also kind of not. Very off putting.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2195383"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2195383#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2194833" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2194833" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ayehduh"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1777464"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1777464.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ayehduh" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Etat-Libre-d-Orange/I-am-Trash-Les-Fleurs-du-Dechet-50009.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50009.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="I am Trash - Les Fleurs du Dchet"title="I am Trash - Les Fleurs du Dchet"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2194833ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2194833" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1777464">ayehduh</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-21">06/21/24 01:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i spray this on me whenever i see it in the store. i don't tend to love sweet fruity scents but for this one i may have to make an exception and pick up a 10ml. on my skin the opening is bright and a little cloying for my tastes but then it dries down into the most beautiful woody musk and i keep sniffing my wrist for hours. like a glimpse into a flirtier, more agreeable version of myself. i would wear this on a date with someone i like but don't see a future with. good fun</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2193417" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LoafyLady"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1601079"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="LoafyLady" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2193417ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2193417" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86); Some slight plasticky characteristic underneath that seems to work with the fruity smell. It reminds me of old dried fruits and my grandma. <br />
Agree with others its a tad syrupy. Interesting scent and I dont hate it but would never spend money on it unless my nose changed drastically.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2193417"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2193417#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2192836" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1799217">aquilegiia</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-18">06/18/24 17:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was so excited about this fragrance, but it doesn't seem to fit my skin chemistry. It's such a shame, since it smelled so good on paper! Definitely not a blind buy, since on my skin it was all wood and amber and none of the sweet berry notes at all, but the experience may be different for others.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1822978">gostodemanga</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-18">06/18/24 07:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>this perfume is the perfect girly fragrance! if the color pink had a smell it would smell like this. only downside is that it only lasts around 3 hours on my skin but i have purchased the 100ml bottle so i dont mind having to reapply it. the strawberry notes really shines through and this smells really sweet but not in an overbearing way, its just right! it might become my signature/day to day perfume alongside jpg so scandal</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2191874"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2191874#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2190680" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2190680" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Teepeeps"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1454251"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1454251.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Teepeeps" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Aqua-Allegoria-Herba-Fresca-60.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.60.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aqua Allegoria Herba Fresca"title="Aqua Allegoria Herba Fresca"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2190680ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2190680" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1454251">Teepeeps</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-17">06/17/24 05:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was amazed to love this. Its very simple, a sweet synthetic strawberry syrup/ice cream top note that is so reminiscent of childhood. It has a beautiful vanilla amber musk base that reminds me of candy floss. Strangely though, its airy so not cloying in the sweetness, which makes it very wearable on me. Its not a body spray either, there is roundness and depth there. As an EDP its not heavy and I would suggest a very easy wear. A nice change from the vanilla forward caramel heavy gourmands. I dont find it boring as this level of pretty is usually floral and even if its fruit, its never strawberry.<br />
<br />
Yes, its what we would call traditionally feminine but I think i would be delighted if a chap could carry this off because in one sense the Strawberry is such an English note and the take on it quite charming. My long suffering partner is going to be a guinea pig again I think </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2190680"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2190680#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2189482" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2189482" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Richa30"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2033662"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Richa30" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2189482ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2189482" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85); It smelled like spoiled / curdled milk with some strawberries thrown in. Not sure if the tester was rancid. Might have to give it another try but pass for now since there are too many other perfumes on my wish list </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2189482"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2189482#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2189131" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2189131" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="radicaleah"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/148600"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.148600.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="radicaleah" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2189131ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2189131" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/148600">radicaleah</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-15">06/15/24 10:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I ended up selling my bottle. When sprayed in the air, I liked this scent but something in it kept stinging/burning my nose when I wore it on my skin. It bothered me to the point where I couldnt tolerate it. The Elixir version does the same thing but Im not sure why. But anyway, its very strawberry milkshake; fresh, sweet, and creamy - but its sharp in a strange way to my nose.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2189131"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2189131#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2188748" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; They remind me of a fruity candy, not fresh fruit, but they are still nice and easy to wear.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2185566"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2185566#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2185563" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2185563" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LeChemiste"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1514260"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1514260.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LeChemiste" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Kenzo/Flower-Ikebana-Mimosa-90716.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.90716.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Flower Ikebana Mimosa"title="Flower Ikebana Mimosa"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2185563ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2185563" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1514260">LeChemiste</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-11">06/11/24 23:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Something about Burberry Her reminds me of a fruity flavoured vape? Not in a bad way, it just has that "burnt sugar" quality similar to BR540. Also, this could be a Mandela Effect on my part, but I remember testing this one in 2020. in a perfumery, and it smelled more fruity and woody, and much less Baccarat-ish. At first when I saw people on tiktok comparing it with BR540, I was perplexed as to how they drew the connection. Nowadays, newer samples I've tried DEFINITELY have a strong punch of that Ariana Grande Cloud and Baccarat vibe. Strange, could it be that the OG Burberry Her was reformulated along the way?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2185563"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2185563#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2185081" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2185081" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="enoor"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2163084"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2163084.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="enoor" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2185081ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2185081" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2163084">enoor</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-11">06/11/24 11:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The opening smells mildly fruity but it dries down to smell almost indistinguishable from BR540. Save your coin and get this instead.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2185081"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2185081#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2185038" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2183097" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Marnet"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2161123"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2161123.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Marnet" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2183097ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2183097" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2161123">Marnet</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-09">06/09/24 12:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This perfume has a very strong synthetic smell to it, and the sweetness is very overpowering. <br />
It has far too many notes, the perfume just smells chaotic.<br />
 <br />
Every time I smell this perfume on someone I think they vape, bc it smells like strawberry flavored vape! Thats how synthetic it smells</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2183097"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2183097#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2182374" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2182374" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bambilady"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2027141"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2027141.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="bambilady" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Delina-43871.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43871.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Delina"title="Delina"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2182374ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2182374" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2027141">bambilady</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-08">06/08/24 16:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's like a tiny treasure trove of joy, sweet strawberries and a cuddle from your favorite childhood fluffy bunny all wrapped up in a bottle. Imagine the perfect sunshine girl in a romantic comedy... that's exactly how this perfume smells like to me and I can't get over it omg... I'm completely in love and it's definitely my forever signature scent. It also lasts a long time on my skin, although I've heard people state the opposite. (I do layer quite alot so that contributes to it)<br />
<br />
P.S: I initially came here to comment that this is /Exactly/ what I imagine Hachi from Nana smells like, and the most recent review says just that as well. Love that. <br />
<br />
It's just so girly and dreamy. The perfumers were in that lab with one thing and one thing only in mind when they mixed this up: and it was to make something cute and sweet for the girls. Herstory was made.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2182374"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2182374#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2180893" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; The smell is there for days. I expected something other-worldly (idk why, it was just hyped that way I guess), but it's just a run-of-the-mill out of the shower fragrance. I get the lemon for sure. Maybe a hint of musk? Definitely something I would describe as "generic-berries." It reminds me of several other perfumes without letting me pinpoint exactly what it is that it reminds me of. <br />
Thank god for sample vials!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2180165"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2180165#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2178006" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Because I boycott a lot of designer perfumes I have the dupe of this from Eden Perfumes that is cruelty free and vegan.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2176089"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2176089#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2175673" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2175673" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Melody Valentine"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1747732"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Melody Valentine" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/Love-Don-t-Be-Shy-4322.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4322.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Love Don't Be Shy"title="Love Don't Be Shy"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2175673ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2175673" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1747732">Melody Valentine</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-02">06/02/24 10:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>@genevieves You highly doubt a mega rich celebrity would ask for one of her perfumes to smell like a perfume she likes? Why? You think she needed tiktok to tell her about it? Ariana Grande would have been well aware of BR540 before it went viral and very well could have asked for it to smell similar but more girly and sweet. I'm not the first to have said this. A couple of her scents are similar to niche perfumes and it's not a stretch to think it's because she likes them and based her scents on them. R.E.M is said to smell like Coffee Break and was released one year after it. I didn't mean she made it smell like BR coz it was popular but you can highly doubt it if you like. Doesn't change the fact that all of these perfumes DO smell similar despite how many people protest that they smell nothing alike.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2175673"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2175673#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2173850" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2173850" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pucigatto64"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/229707"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="pucigatto64" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Zara/Red-Temptation-For-Her-63264.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.63264.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Red Temptation For Her"title="Red Temptation For Her"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2173850ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2173850" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/229707">pucigatto64</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-31">05/31/24 14:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A vile,synthetic,sweetish "smell" as revolting as Baccarat 540.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2173850"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2173850#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2173619" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2173619" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hysteria1988"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2081331"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2081331.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="hysteria1988" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lattafa-Perfumes/Yara-Candy-95752.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.95752.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Yara Candy"title="Yara Candy"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2173619ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2173619" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2081331">hysteria1988</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-31">05/31/24 11:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Purchsed a 50ml of this on a whim as it was on sale. <br />
<br />
What a great little fragrance! I don't really detect most of the red fruits listed, to me it smells very much like grape, and by that, I mean the flavour found in grape Fanta or Laffy taffy, with a bit of sticky plum and then citrus from the mandarin and lemon.<br />
<br />
After the initial drydown the violet makes itself known, a hint of parma violets and musk, it turns powdery and a little more grown up. Then comes the vanilla, but to me it isn't a sweet cloying vanilla, its a powdery light vanilla. Overall I really love this scent though the sillage isn't that great, I have to be pretty close to my skin to smell it, and the longevity isn't great either. I must pick up the lotion to see how that helps with the longevity.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2173619"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2173619#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2172860" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2006495">jadelouisa</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-30">05/30/24 17:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This was a blind buy for me, going for the 30ml<br />
bottle and im kinda glad i didnt buy a full size. It smells good, but honestly a little too synthetic for my liking. Lots of fruity notes, reminds me of summer. The fact that i dont love it is not stopping me from wearing it, and ive gotten quite soms compliments while wearing this perfume. its not my cup of tea, but it does smell great </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; Even dries down into something more masculine i would say... Don't really like it</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2171142"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2171142#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2170952" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2170952" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Gladys&amp;Glynnis"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2111089"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2111089.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Gladys&amp;Glynnis" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2170952ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2170952" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2111089">Gladys&amp;Glynnis</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-28">05/28/24 22:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Yes, hints of BR540 in the dry down. I didnt believe it at first, but hours after I had forgotten what I sprayed I kept thinking, Baccarat? The opening is a fruity, musky, synthetic and tart explosion that I found mostly cloying, but its growing on me. I pick up some violet in the middle. Longevity isnt great.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2170952"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2170952#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2168438" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2168438" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hiheyitschloe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2134372"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="hiheyitschloe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Valentino/Voce-Viva-Intensa-68560.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.68560.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Voce Viva Intensa"title="Voce Viva Intensa"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2168438ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2168438" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2134372">hiheyitschloe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-26">05/26/24 10:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The strawberry definitely hits you right in the face when you spray it and continues to last into the skin for hours after. The projection is so-so after it begins to dry down and I think I would like this more if it didnt smell so artificial. It smells like those cheap strawberry lip balms youd wear in middle school, but its not necessarily the kind of scent I foresee a teenager wearing. Definitely a pretty perfume for after the shower, but for me personally, the artificial strawberry scent gave me a headache after an hour or so.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2168438"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2168438#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2168046" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2168046" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Littlethingsweetpea"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1501638"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1501638.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Littlethingsweetpea" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2168046ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2168046" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1501638">Littlethingsweetpea</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-25">05/25/24 23:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Fruity, floral, fresh out the shower perfume. Good for summer. Blends in with sweat and heat without making you smell gross. Very feminine and attractive fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2168046"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2168046#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2166359" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2166359" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="amanda45"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2117129"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2117129.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="amanda45" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Michel-Germain/Sugarful-Kiss-84183.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.84183.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sugarful Kiss"title="Sugarful Kiss"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2166359ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2166359" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2117129">amanda45</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-24">05/24/24 06:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Its a really pretty fragrance. I get a hint of the strawberry with the raspberry taking over with lemon on the backend of the fruitiness. Violet is really prominent in the mids, with the musk, vanilla and amber being very present in the dry down. Ive got to say there really isnt any sillage and will definitely need to be reapplied multiple times in a day. I like the scent, but Im glad I only picked up a travel size.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51694"comment_id="2166359"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html?ccid=2166359#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2164688" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
